snippet: At poetry slam nights, Natasha Charron often shares the struggles of her life, which include homelessness and losing custody of a child more than four years ago.
abstract: Brooklyn Community Services draws money from a fund to help Natasha Charron, who is living in a city shelter and hoping to start community college in the spring, buy winter clothing for herself and her infant son.
lead_paragraph: At poetry slam nights, Natasha Charron often shares the struggles of her life, which include homelessness and losing custody of a child more than four years ago.

headline.print_headline: For a Woman’s Poetry Readings, an Unending List of Struggles to Draw From
headline.seo: For Her Poetry, an Unending List of Struggles to Draw From
headline.main: For Woman’s Poetry, an Unending List of Struggles to Draw From

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
